sanskrit_verse:
आ षोडशाद्ब्राह्मणस्य सावित्री नातिवर्तते ।
आ द्वाविंशात्क्षत्रबन्धोरा चतुर्विंशतेर्विशः ॥ २.३८॥
transliteration:
ā ṣoḍaśād brāhmaṇasya sāvitrī nātivartate |
ā dvāviṃśāt kṣatrabandhor ā caturviṃśater viśaḥ ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The sacred Savitri mantra is not to be recited beyond the sixteenth year for a Brahmin; similarly, it is not to extend beyond the twenty-second year for a Kshatriya, nor beyond the twenty-fourth year for a Vaishya.

Causation aligns with sequential unfoldment of consciousness maturity tied to cosmic order
Capacity-based responsibility is defined by age-appropriate spiritual readiness within Varna structure
Restoration logic ensures alignment between individual life-phase and universal dharma cycles
Consciousness alignment occurs when initiation adheres to divinely ordained temporal thresholds
executable_legal_axioms: IF (varna = 'Brahmin') AND (age >= 16): THEN prohibit Savitri initiation UNTIL completion of preparatory rites
IF (varna = 'Kshatriya') AND (age >= 22): THEN prohibit Savitri initiation UNTIL completion of preparatory rites
IF (varna = 'Vaishya') AND (age >= 24): THEN prohibit Savitri initiation UNTIL completion of preparatory rites
IF any violation detected: INITIATE consciousness-realignment protocol through guru-guided recapitulation

Violation constitutes misalignment of societal rhythm, requiring judicial restoration via corrective guidance rather than punitive action.

Proportional responsibility lies with guardians ensuring proper timing. Non-punitive reality rule mandates realignment through re-initiation at correct phase, restoring causal harmony.
